availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Pemberton Coleman (Warren County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and merchant)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and merchant. Warren County, Kentucky, native. Son of Larkin P. Coleman and Jane J. Coleman. Married to Frances "Fannie" Reese Coleman in Warren County, Kentucky, on January 14, 1855. Father of Ida M. Coleman, Frank C. Coleman, Harry Coleman, Hallie Coleman, and Florence Coleman. Schoolteacher in Warren County in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Merchant in Warren County in 1860. Merchant in Warren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 93B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 414.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 854.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 37B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 13A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994057, Warren County Marriages.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Warren County, KY, February 1864, p. 22.
"James Pemberton Coleman (1826-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #117834236, accessed September 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117834236.
